intro: Solanum lachneion var. abbreviatum, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features small, oval leaves with a hairy surface. Its flowers are usually violet or blue, and it produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. This variety is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
